CRD_Astarion.synopsis: You find a contemplative Astarion thinking about the danger we pose if we turn into mind flayers. He asks - hypothetically - if he had to kill us, how would we like to go? As an experienced murderer, he considers it a professional courtesy, but we might be outraged. He'll be enthusiastic when describing the different ways people can die - a fan talking about his favourite subject. If we threaten him, he'll be defensive and a little sulky.

CRD_Karlach.synopsis: The player approaches Karlach on their second night at camp.
CRD_Karlach.how_to_trigger: 1. Recruit Karlach as a companion.2. oe qnight NIGHT_Ceremorphosis2_485f589f-0da1-4eea-9a28-210f91837a693. Speak with her.

CRD_Laezel.synopsis: The player approaches Lae'zel on their second night at camp. She is disturbed that you have not yet begun to turn into a mind flayer as expected.

CRD_Gale.how_to_trigger: recruit Galeoe qnight NIGHT_Ceremorphosis2_485f589f-0da1-4eea-9a28-210f91837a69Go to camp, cinematic auto triggers upon arrival

CRD_Wyll.synopsis: The player talks to Wyll on their second night at camp.
CRD_Wyll.how_to_trigger: 1. Recruit Wyll as a companion.2. oe qnight NIGHT_Ceremorphosis2_485f589f-0da1-4eea-9a28-210f91837a693. Speak with him.

CRD_Shadowheart.synopsis: The party stops to camp for the night - the second instance of this happening. Shadowheart seeks to confide in the player about what's been happening to them, in particular the tadpole parasite lodged in their heads and the transformation that is supposed to follow. Curiously, they realise that they both feel fine - contrary to what is thought to occur.

CRD_Narrator_3.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_3.text: *One breath in, one breath out. Slowly, gently.*

CRD_Narrator_0.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_0.text: *You take stock of your senses. Your hearing is sharp, your mind is lucid. You feel no pain, no fever, no ill sensations.*

CRD_Narrator_1.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_1.text: *Resistance to the sun's rays aside, you feel no different than you did a tenday ago. You are still you.*

CRD_Narrator_5.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_5.text: *Old questions give way to a new one: shouldn't you have begun to change by now?*

CRD_Narrator_4.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_4.text: *Another breath in, another breath out. You can worry and wonder tomorrow. Until then, you must rest.*

CRD_Astarion_19.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_19.text: I saw you getting a lecture from our magical friend.

CRD_Astarion_50.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_50.text: I have to say, I thought you'd look worse, but no. Not a tentacle to be seen.

CRD_Astarion_2.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_2.text: That's what everyone's saying. Is it so strange?

CRD_Astarion_25.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_25.text: It's unexpected, but we shan't complain.

CRD_Astarion_48.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_48.text: I'm not taking anything for granted, of course. First sign of change and I'll have to stop that pretty little heart of yours.

CRD_Astarion_49.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_49.text: I'm hoping it'll stay that way.

CRD_Astarion_71.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_71.text: Naturally. But I was thinking: what if it doesn't?

CRD_Astarion_32.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_32.text: Of course, first sign of change and I'll have to stop that pretty little heart of yours.

CRD_Astarion_40.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_40.text: I am open to suggestions. Knives, poison, strangulation - whatever you'd prefer.

CRD_Astarion_5.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_5.text: Killing me would rather decrease your odds of survival. Dramatically, in fact.

CRD_Astarion_51.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_51.text: Should that happen, my advice would be to drop your weapon and run. Very, very fast.

CRD_Astarion_26.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_26.text: Don't make me choose! There are too many good options.

CRD_Astarion_41.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_41.text: Well, that's a little dramatic, don't you think?

CRD_Astarion_69.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_69.text: Well now you're just being close-minded. There are some lovely ways to go.

CRD_Astarion_72.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_72.text: I've watched urchins freeze to death on the street. It looks peaceful - just like falling asleep.

CRD_Astarion_52.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_52.text: Come on, humour me. If you had to choose...

CRD_Astarion_23.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_23.text: Poison, then. It should be painless at least.

CRD_Astarion_61.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_61.text: Then I suppose we'll just see what happens.

CRD_Astarion_33.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_33.text: Don't worry, darling. I like you. I'm sure I'll make the right choice.

CRD_Astarion_30.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_30.text: I'd rather have one of the others do it.

CRD_Astarion_7.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_7.text: Oh, I see how it is.

CRD_Astarion_10.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_10.text: Fine, but if they botch it - don't come bleeding to me.

CRD_Astarion_38.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_38.text: Then I'll ask someone else to do it.

CRD_Astarion_57.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_57.text: A classic! One good thrust to the heart and you're gone.

CRD_Astarion_58.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_58.text: We need a good blade, of course. Don't want to waste time hacking and prodding with a dinner knife...

CRD_Astarion_46.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_46.text: A fine choice! I can think of some nightshades that are deliciously fatal.

CRD_Astarion_43.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_43.text: If they're mixed well, you'll just close your eyes and drift away. And if they're not...
CRD_Astarion_43.context: NodeContext: 'if they're not you'll die horribly.' is the unspoken end to that line.

CRD_Astarion_63.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_63.text: Well, I'm getting ahead of myself. This is all a worst case scenario, obviously.

CRD_Astarion_42.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_42.text: Obviously. But that won't happen. It can't.

CRD_Astarion_21.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_21.text: If the last day has taught me anything, it's that the impossible is more likely than you think.

CRD_Astarion_28.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_28.text: Now, let's get some rest? The sooner we start tomorrow, the better our chances of keeping this hypothetical.

CRD_Astarion_60.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_60.text: And you? How should I kill you?

CRD_Astarion_73.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_73.text: Ha! Oh, my dear. I'd like to see you try.

CRD_Astarion_75.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_75.text: See you in the morning. Sweet dreams, darling.

CRD_Astarion_9.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_9.text: Try it and I'll spill your guts.

CRD_Astarion_4.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_4.text: Don't be so pig-headed, I'm being practical.

CRD_Astarion_3.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_3.text: How much damage will you cause if you transform? How much blood can you bear to have on your hands?

CRD_Astarion_35.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_35.text: I'm afraid I'm deadly serious. Try it, and I'm taking everyone with me. Everyone.

CRD_Astarion_18.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_18.text: I like you. Rest assured, whatever happens, I'll make the right choice.

CRD_Astarion_22.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_22.text: If I had to choose, I'd want the knife. Make it quick.

CRD_Astarion_24.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_24.text: If I die, I'll take you with me.

CRD_Astarion_54.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_54.text: Ha! I do like you, you know. You've got fire.

CRD_Astarion_56.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_56.text: Whatever happens, I'll make the right choice.

CRD_Astarion_68.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_68.text: Not sure. How would you like to go?

CRD_Astarion_37.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_37.text: I don't think poison is for me. Nor stabbing, come to think of it.
CRD_Astarion_37.context: NodeContext: He's wondering if you can even poison a vampire.

CRD_Astarion_66.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_66.text: I've always felt decapitation was a fine choice. One good swing and then - nothing.

CRD_Astarion_17.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_17.text: But we were talking about you. What'll it be?

CRD_Astarion_15.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_15.text: A fine choice. Now, to use sword or axe? Or a saw? Hmm.

CRD_Astarion_14.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_14.text: I could say the same to you.

CRD_Astarion_62.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_62.text: Indeed you could. We're all doing surprisingly well, given the circumstances.

CRD_Astarion_47.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_47.text: Sounds like you've been learning all about your gruesome future.

CRD_Astarion_53.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_53.text: So. Not a tentacle to be seen.

CRD_Astarion_65.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_65.text: I saw our gith friend inspecting you.

CRD_Karlach_45.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach is standing with her eyes closed, a smile on her lips, swaying a little, seemingly lost in the moment. She registers your presence without opening her eyes.

CRD_Karlach_0.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_0.text: What am I listening for, exactly?

CRD_Karlach_10.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_10.text: Crackling fire. A little breeze. I love it here. So much.
CRD_Karlach_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Opens her eyes with a big grin after 'A little breeze'.

CRD_Karlach_29.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_29.text: A bit of a breeze, a snapping twig?

CRD_Karlach_6.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_6.text: Yes! And the fire, and a faint murmur in the distance. I love it here. So much.
CRD_Karlach_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Opens her eyes with a big grin on 'Yes!'

CRD_Karlach_5.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_5.text: Well, I'm certainly part of it! The breeze, the fire, me big stupid head. I love it here. So much.
CRD_Karlach_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Her eyes snap openNodeContext: Laughingly

CRD_Karlach_13.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_13.text: This camp. Faerûn. Toril. The Material Plane. Paradise.

CRD_Karlach_18.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_18.text: After where you've been, I'm not surprised this place seems like heaven.

CRD_Karlach_28.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_28.context: NodeContext: To mean 'that's exactly it' in a world-weary kind of way.

CRD_Karlach_32.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_32.text: And it is, in loads of places. But here? Here we've got it all.

CRD_Karlach_38.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_38.text: Gods, I hope there's a better paradise than this out there.

CRD_Karlach_23.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_23.text: Greedy bastard. Look around you. A beautiful, interesting world, a few risks and bothers to keep us on our toes. Friends, food, a bed to sleep in. I'm telling you, this is it.

CRD_Karlach_2.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_2.text: And do you want to know my favourite part?

CRD_Karlach_51.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_51.text: That ranks very high indeed, but my honest-to-gods favourite thing is grass.

CRD_Karlach_30.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_30.text: You're in the top ten. But I was thinking of... grass.

CRD_Karlach_22.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_22.text: Oh my gods, grass. Perfect, soft, grave-hair. Feels like heaven between the toes.

CRD_Karlach_7.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_7.text: Granted this isn't the world's best spot for grassing, but I've taken my opportunities where I could.

CRD_Karlach_41.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_41.text: No grass in Avernus, I'm guessing.

CRD_Karlach_47.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_47.text: Only blades there are bloody. When I stumbled off that nautiloid and onto the banks of the Chionthar, the first thing I did was find something green to fall in.

CRD_Karlach_4.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_4.text: I hadn't taken you for a frolicker.

CRD_Karlach_9.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_9.text: Baby, I'm nothing if not frolicsome.

CRD_Karlach_27.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_27.text: Damn, I'm so fucking happy to be back.

CRD_Karlach_34.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_34.text: Even if this place, this moment, isn't your idea of heaven, believe me: it could be a gixillion times worse.

CRD_Karlach_49.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_49.text: I don't need to hear more about your toes, thanks.

CRD_Karlach_43.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_43.text: Sorry, I forgot about your delicate sensibilities. But you know what? I wouldn't change a thing about you.
CRD_Karlach_43.context: NodeContext: With a laugh. She's not flirting, just appreciating you.

CRD_Karlach_44.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_44.text: My mum used to call it that. Said to tread with care, cause every blade might've been fed by someone important to someone.

CRD_Karlach_37.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_37.text: I know exactly what you mean.

CRD_Karlach_26.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_26.text: Grass. Perfect, soft, grave-hair. Heaven between the toes.

CRD_Karlach_25.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_25.text: Well, I'm going to tell you anyway.

CRD_Karlach_21.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_21.text: There is a far finer paradise than this waiting for those who serve the gods.

CRD_Karlach_50.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_50.text: You can keep it. I'd rather live for myself in this heaven than live for someone else in another.

CRD_Karlach_17.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_17.text: I've got everything I need in abundance, right here. Including my favourite thing.

CRD_Karlach_42.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_42.text: I feel like you want me to ask what your favourite thing is. But I don't want to ask.

CRD_Karlach_35.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_35.text: It's grass. Perfect, soft grave-hair. Heaven between the toes.

CRD_Karlach_52.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_52.text: Rest up, soldier. Who knows what tomorrow's got in store for us?

CRD_Laezel_13.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_13.context: NodeContext: Tchak'i = Chalk-ee, a bit guttural sounding.

CRD_Laezel_17.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_17.text: I didn't think you cared, Lae'zel.

CRD_Laezel_9.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_9.text: Dry skin, clear eyes, stolid bearing. You do not suffer - you flourish.

CRD_Laezel_20.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_20.text: Abominations grow inside us. Our bones should ache, our mouths should bleed.

CRD_Laezel_24.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_24.text: Yet we thrive. It is madness.

CRD_Laezel_10.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_10.text: Keep your rest short. Time is not our ally.

CRD_Laezel_25.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_25.text: How much longer before we start noticing symptoms?

CRD_Laezel_4.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_4.text: Our bones should ache, our mouths should bleed.

CRD_Laezel_5.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_5.text: Perhaps we should keep our distance from now on.

CRD_Laezel_19.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_19.text: As if I craved another whiff of sour breath.

CRD_Laezel_0.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_0.text: On the contrary. This is most excellent news.

CRD_Laezel_23.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_23.text: Dry scales, clear eyes. You do not suffer - you flourish.

CRD_Laezel_11.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_11.text: Dry skin, clear eyes. You do not suffer - you flourish.

CRD_Laezel_6.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_6.text: It is what I do not see that concerns me.

CRD_Laezel_22.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_22.text: Abominations grow inside us. Our bones should ache, our mouths should bleed.

CRD_Laezel_8.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_8.text: Yet we thrive. It is madness.

CRD_Gale_6.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_6.text: Be with you in a moment!

CRD_Gale_72.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_72.text: Indulging in a spot of vanity. Handsome devil, aren't I?

CRD_Gale_71.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_71.text: Not a trick, my friend. Magic!

CRD_Gale_10.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_10.text: All that wizardry makes me uncomfortable.

CRD_Gale_27.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_27.text: Whatever for? Look at him! Never too much of a good thing, I say.

CRD_Gale_3.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Duped and mirrored Perfromance Data - (He dispels the double with a flourish.)

CRD_Gale_30.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_30.text: Ceremorphosis. What does it make you think of?

CRD_Gale_17.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_17.text: First and foremost: that damn tadpole.

CRD_Gale_66.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_66.text: Day one: fever and memory loss.

CRD_Gale_19.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_19.text: Day two: hallucinations and greying skin.

CRD_Gale_53.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_53.text: Day three: hair loss and blood leaking from all orifices.

CRD_Gale_14.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_14.text: Day four: excruciating pain as the skeleton and organs reform and reposition.

CRD_Gale_73.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_73.text: Day five: the host's personality has disappeared. Fingers, toes and limbs elongate.

CRD_Gale_15.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_15.text: I take it you get the picture?

CRD_Gale_65.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_65.text: I do, but you might as well finish the picture.

CRD_Gale_32.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_32.text: I do, but I'd like to see if you get the rest right.

CRD_Gale_39.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_39.text: Day six: the flesh around the mouth splits to make way for tentacles.

CRD_Gale_0.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_0.text: Day seven: a mind flayer is born.

CRD_Gale_79.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_79.text: This is the abridged version of course.

CRD_Gale_16.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_16.text: A very vivid picture. And very upsetting.

CRD_Gale_57.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_57.text: My point is this: our orifices remain blissfully unbloodied. Our heads remain clear, and our blood temperature normal.

CRD_Gale_55.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_55.text: This version was more than vivid enough for my tastes.

CRD_Gale_61.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_61.text: We should be having a fever by now. Greying skin even.

CRD_Gale_29.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_29.text: Our orifices remain blissfully unbloodied. Our heads remain clear, and our blood temperature normal.

CRD_Gale_24.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_24.text: Any expert will agree: this is... abnormal.

CRD_Gale_42.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_42.text: The pragmatic in me, however, sees only the silence before the storm.

CRD_Gale_68.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_68.text: Something to sleep on. We should get some rest.

CRD_Gale_52.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_52.text: Can you explain why the symptoms aren't showing?

CRD_Gale_75.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_75.text: That, alas, is where my knowledge fails me.

CRD_Gale_7.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_7.text: A rogue might call it luck; a priest might call it fate.

CRD_Gale_37.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_37.text: As for myself: I'm a pragmatic. I see the silence before the storm.

CRD_Gale_33.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_33.text: And what makes you the expert?

CRD_Gale_25.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_25.text: But what is happening, or rather not happening to us, is entirely undocumented.

CRD_Gale_63.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_63.text: Uncharted territory. The silence before the storm.

CRD_Gale_34.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_34.text: Agreed. This is not the version I learned by heart.

CRD_Gale_58.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_58.text: What is happening, or rather not happening to us, is entirely undocumented.

CRD_Gale_47.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_47.text: Dragon blood is hardy stuff. I'm not surprised I'm immune.

CRD_Gale_80.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_80.text: Yes, but that doesn't quite explain little old me, now does it?

CRD_Gale_12.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_12.text: Just wrap this up, will you?

CRD_Gale_76.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_76.text: A faultless if abridged version of the facts.

CRD_Gale_41.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_41.text: Shake your head. You know this routine all too well.

CRD_Gale_67.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_67.text: Until quite recently, nothing at all.

CRD_Gale_62.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_62.text: Ah, yes. The good old days.

CRD_Gale_13.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_13.text: If you're about to start a lecture, I'm not interested.

CRD_Gale_35.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_35.text: Thanks to the tadpole, we should have developed more than invasive symptoms by now, but we haven't.

CRD_Gale_64.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_64.text: Not the prettiest of transmutations, is it?

CRD_Gale_40.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_40.text: I saw Lae'zel giving you a look-over. Great minds think alike.

CRD_Gale_51.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_51.text: No doubt she came to the same conclusion: we're healthier than we should be.

CRD_Gale_82.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_82.text: Why are you studying your own mirror image?

CRD_Gale_46.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_46.text: Typical. A wizard using magic just to admire his own beard.

CRD_Gale_81.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_81.text: A gentleman's only as dashing as his least groomed locus.

CRD_Gale_18.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_18.text: Make it dance. Oh, or breathe fire!

CRD_Gale_48.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_48.text: It's done all that and more at plenty a soirée, I can tell you.

CRD_Wyll_20.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_20.text: Question for you: have you ever heard a banshee's scream?

CRD_Wyll_22.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_22.text: Mm - for the best that you haven't. An agonising wail. Loud enough to wake the dead, and shrill enough to shatter a golden goblet.

CRD_Wyll_14.speaker: Player
CRD_Wyll_14.text: Yes. It made a terrible howl.

CRD_Wyll_19.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_19.text: Incredible, wasn't it? Loud enough to wake the dead, and shrill enough to shatter a golden goblet.

CRD_Wyll_21.speaker: Player
CRD_Wyll_21.text: No, but I once made one whimper a bit.

CRD_Wyll_10.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_10.text: Yes, well - ahem. If you'd ever actually heard one, you'd not heard a whimper, but a wail.
CRD_Wyll_10.context: NodeContext: Hemming and hawing after a slightly lascivious joke.

CRD_Wyll_6.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_6.text: Loud enough to wake the dead, and shrill enough to shatter a golden goblet.

CRD_Wyll_7.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_7.text: I thought it the most terrible noise in all sixteen planes. But there's one even more fearsome than that.

CRD_Wyll_16.speaker: Player
CRD_Wyll_16.text: The shrieks of the goblins at the grove's gates?

CRD_Wyll_18.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_18.text: They screeched most horribly, yes - but I know of one even more ruthless:

CRD_Wyll_9.speaker: Player
CRD_Wyll_9.text: The clatter of the rising undead?

CRD_Wyll_23.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_23.text: They do clack out a dreadful rhythm. But the one I'm thinking of is even more dire:

CRD_Wyll_15.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_15.text: Not even close. I find them comforting, even. What I'm thinking of is far more malicious:

CRD_Wyll_25.speaker: Player
CRD_Wyll_25.text: I bet it's Astarion's flirtatious drawl.

CRD_Wyll_12.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_12.text: Oh, the lad's quite the tease. But he's a charming sort of cad - well, most of the time.

CRD_Wyll_11.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_11.text: No, I was thinking of a far more loathsome sound:

CRD_Wyll_26.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_26.text: The doubt in our minds crying out for attention.

CRD_Wyll_17.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_17.text: 'It's hopeless', it says. 'Stop resisting. Give up and give in.'

CRD_Wyll_13.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_13.text: Doubt is the greatest villain we face. Greater than all the Hells' devils, greater than a murderous god.

CRD_Wyll_2.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_2.text: Most people don't find it so easy to conquer. It's a good thing for us that we aren't 'most people'.

CRD_Wyll_3.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_3.text: Slay your doubt, and nothing can stop you. Not a demon, not a dragon, and certainly not an illithid worm.

CRD_Wyll_1.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_1.text: I'm glad to see you're not one to give up.

CRD_Wyll_24.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Wyll_24.text: We should rest these weary bones of ours.

CRD_Shadowheart_2.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_2.text: Fine. Much better than I thought I would, given the circumstances.

CRD_Shadowheart_25.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_25.text: Yes... me as well. Besides the occasional mental exchange, it's almost as if we're not infected.
CRD_Shadowheart_25.context: NodeContext: 'mental exchange' being a conversational term for the mind meld phenomenon they've experienced.

CRD_Shadowheart_18.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_18.text: I feel... good. It's so strange... do you remember the voice? Aboard the ship?

CRD_Shadowheart_12.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_12.text: Honestly? More than a little frightened.

CRD_Shadowheart_10.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_10.text: Me too. It's hard to sleep knowing that thing is in your head.

CRD_Shadowheart_27.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_27.text: But other than the occasional mental exchange, it's almost as if we're not infected.

CRD_Shadowheart_19.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_19.text: I don't know. How do you feel?

CRD_Shadowheart_14.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_14.text: Better than I ought to. Other than the occasional mental exchange, it's almost as if we're not infected.
CRD_Shadowheart_14.context: NodeContext: 'mental exchange' being a conversational term for the mind meld phenomenon they've experienced.

CRD_Shadowheart_29.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_29.text: It's so strange... do you remember the voice? From the ship?

CRD_Shadowheart_13.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_13.text: Yes, almost like it's whispering to me still...

CRD_Shadowheart_6.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_6.text: The voice said I'd become a 'beautiful weapon'. What do you think that means?

CRD_Shadowheart_41.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_41.text: I don't know. But Halsin might - if we can find him.

CRD_Shadowheart_17.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_17.text: Anything's possible. But we still need to find a healer.

CRD_Shadowheart_35.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_35.text: Agreed. We can't take the lack of symptoms for granted.

CRD_Shadowheart_0.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_0.text: All right, I've kept you from your blanket long enough. Rest well.

CRD_Shadowheart_30.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_30.text: Sounds like it had plans for us.

CRD_Shadowheart_22.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_22.text: Whatever they were, those plans were interrupted by the dragons.

CRD_Shadowheart_34.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_34.text: Weapon...? Might be connected to those powers we gained.
CRD_Shadowheart_34.context: InternalNodeContext: FLAG NEEDED - CHECKING THAT TADPOLE POWERS HAVE BEEN GAINED

CRD_Shadowheart_23.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_23.text: I suppose so. They've certainly been useful in a tight spot...

CRD_Shadowheart_39.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_39.text: But there will be a price to pay. We can't take the lack of symptoms for granted.

CRD_Shadowheart_37.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_37.text: The sooner we find a healer, the better. Get some rest.

CRD_Shadowheart_38.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_38.text: The sooner we find Halsin, the better. Get some rest.

CRD_Shadowheart_28.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_28.text: Who knows? Could've been a hallucination. I'm just glad we're still alive.

CRD_Shadowheart_33.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_33.text: For now. But we can't take the lack of symptoms for granted. We have to keep looking for a healer.

CRD_Shadowheart_26.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_26.text: For now. But we can't take the lack of symptoms for granted. We have to keep looking for Halsin.

CRD_Shadowheart_31.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_31.text: I've said my piece. Good night.

CRD_Shadowheart_8.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_8.text: Hah! Adorable. But your timing is awful.

CRD_Shadowheart_21.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_21.text: Whatever the mind flayers' plans were, those dragons spoiled them. That doesn't make our situation less dangerous.

CRD_Shadowheart_3.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_3.text: Either way, we can't take the lack of symptoms for granted. We have to find a healer.

CRD_Shadowheart_42.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_42.text: Well, I've said my piece. Get some rest.

CRD_Shadowheart_15.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_15.text: Either way, we can't take the lack of symptoms for granted. We have to find Halsin.

CRD_Shadowheart_16.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_16.text: After they put that tadpole in my eye, I heard this voice. It was... soothing.

CRD_Shadowheart_36.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_36.text: I was trying not to dwell on it, but thank you for reminding me.

CRD_Shadowheart_32.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_32.text: Sorry... but a problem shared, and so on. We should discuss this.
CRD_Shadowheart_32.context: NodeContext: A little apologetic for bringing up a tricky subject (their infection) but still pressing the issue

CRD_Shadowheart_20.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_20.text: I couldn't help but overhear... well, all right, I could've helped, but didn't.

CRD_Shadowheart_4.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_4.text: Anyway, I feel the same. Other than the occasional mental exchange, it's almost as if we're not infected.
CRD_Shadowheart_4.context: NodeContext: 'mental exchange' being a conversational term for the mind meld phenomenon they've experienced.

CRD_Shadowheart_11.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_11.text: The voice on the ship told me I'd become a 'beautiful weapon'. What do you think it meant?
